channel.title: BBC News - Africa
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Kenyan policeman wakes up from coma to find he was sacked
item.description: Neither his family nor the police force could locate Reuben Kimutai Lel, who was actually in hospital.

item.title: Mozambique militant attacks: 'So much destruction'
item.description: The BBC's Anne Soy sees how Islamic militants have terrorised Cabo Delgado in northern Mozambique

item.title: Kenyan basketballer: Sexual abuse rife for years
item.description: A former basketball player in Kenya says sexual abuse has plagued the country's women's game for "many years".

item.title: British and Malaysian men jailed in Somalia for terror offences
item.description: A military court convicts Darren Anthony Byrnes and a Malaysian man of belonging to al-Shabab.

item.title: Kenya: On the ground in Laikipia's conflict
item.description: Armed herders have been attacking farmers and destroying their homes in the Kenya's Laikipia County.

item.title: UK Covid vaccine rules cause hesitancy - Africa health boss
item.description: The UK's refusal to accept vaccine certificates from Africa could increase hesitancy, says Africa CDC.

item.title: Morocco's Khadija rape case: Eleven jailed for 20 years
item.description: The woman's lawyer says he will appeal, describing the 20-year sentences as "not tough."

item.title: Central African Republic war: No-go zones and Russian meddling
item.description: All sides are accused of planting landmines in a dangerous shift in the Central African Republic.

item.title: Paul Rusesabagina: From Hotel Rwanda hero to convicted terrorist
item.description: Paul Rusesabagina, who was portrayed in Hotel Rwanda, has gone from national hero to enemy of the state.

item.title: South African whistle-blower: I don't feel safe
item.description: Mosilo Mothepu has paid a heavy price for speaking out about corruption in her firm.

item.title: Ethiopia: Fact-checking misleading images about hunger in Amhara
item.description: Food shortages are worsening in Ethiopia but some images online are not what they claim to be.

item.title: Kenya's CBC education reform: How scarecrows are terrifying parents
item.description: A new school curriculum means challenging tasks end up being performed by parents not their children.

item.title: Abdelaziz Bouteflika, Algeria's longest-serving president dies
item.description: The former president, whose decades-long rule sparked massive protests, has died aged 84.

item.title: Street dreams of Nairobi dance crew hoping to beat the odds
item.description: A group of street dancers in Nairobi, Kenya, struggle against the odds to become celebrities.

item.title: Germaine Acogny: 'The mother of contemporary African dance'
item.description: Germaine Acogny has recently been awarded the prestigious Golden Lion award at the Venice Biennale Dance festival. But what impact has she had on African contemporary dance?

item.title: The link between climate change, seaweed and ice cream
item.description: Seaweed production has been affected by warming seas – this is how farmers are adapting.

item.title: Turkana: The front line of climate change
item.description: There are few places in the world where the consequences of a changing climate are as plain to see as in northern Kenya.

item.title: Kenyan blogger: 'I thought I may never make it out of Qatar'
item.description: A Kenyan blogger who wrote about working conditions in Qatar was thrown into solitary confinement, given a huge fine and deported.

item.title: On the trail of fake medicine smugglers in Benin
item.description: Since the beginning of the pandemic, there’s been an increase in counterfeit drugs around the world.

item.title: What's gone wrong with the 'War on Terror' in Africa?
item.description: Twenty years after the US 'War on Terror' began, Islamist movements have spread across Africa.
